Articles.Content: I take a lot of screenshots, and often I have to move all the files to another drive before it fills up my C drive.  Is there a  way to set it up so they automatically go to a different location than the internal screenshots folder?

I don't know if you can within the game, and I'd assume that Steam screenshots could be remapped, but I've never tried.   But if all else fails, running a simple .bat file to copy and delete the screenshots folder should do the trick.  Although, it might run into numbering issues, as I don't know if KSP remembers that last screenshot number taken, or if it just adds one to the last one in the default folder, and you might end up with duplicate file names in the destination folder.

1 minute ago, Gargamel said:

I don't know if KSP remembers that last screenshot number taken, or if it just adds one to the last one in the default folder﻿

It goes off the highest number in the folder.  So if you remove all the pictures, it starts over at 1.

You could probably set up a task to run a bat file that moves everything automatically once a day after creating a timestamp named folder.

The game does not remember numbers.

You can do this using symbolic links, this article will explain it:

https://www.techrepublic.com/article/how-to-take-advantage-of-symbolic-links-in-window-10/
